context.p: The OpenStack and AWS service controllers are automatically registered with APP when the oscm-app container is deployed. Registration means entering the controller with its ID and its responsible organization in the bssapp database. Initially, this is the platform operator organization.

The platform operator can access APP and define the organization responsible for the service controller. This is usually your own organization as a technology provider. However, it may also be another organization with the technology provider role registered with .

ol.li:
In a Web browser, access the Web interface (base URL) of APP in the following format:
https://<hostname.fqdn>:<port>/oscm-app
<hostname.fqdn> is the fully qualified domain name of the machine where APP has been deployed. <port> is the port to address the machine (default: 8881), oscm-app is the default context root of APP and cannot be changed.
Log in with the ID and password of the user which you received with the confirmation email for your user account or as another administrator of the same organization.
Specify the ID of the technology provider organization that is to be responsible for the respective service controller (ess.openstack or ess.aws).
Click Save Configuration to save the settings.
